title: Dosu Joseph
text:
Joseph Dosu (born 19 June 1973 in <a href="Abuja">Abuja</a>) is a former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> from <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>.
Club career.
Dosu helped <a href="Julius%20Berger%20FC">Julius Berger</a> win the Nigerian FA Cup in November 1996, by keeping a clean sheet in the finals against Katsina United. His career came to an abrupt end after a serious car accident in <a href="Lagos">Lagos</a> in 1997, almost left him paralyzed.
After the 1996 Olympics, Dosu signed with <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> club <a href="A.C.%20Reggiana%201919">Reggiana</a>. He never got to make an impact in <a href="Italy">Italy</a> and was forced to hang his boots at a young age of 23, due to his career ending automobile accident.
International career.
He was the only home based player to be included in Nigeria's <a href="1996%20Summer%20Olympics">1996 Olympic</a> team, where despite being the least experienced of the three goalkeepers ended up as the team's first choice goalkeeper. After winning Gold with the <a href="Super%20Eagles">Super Eagles</a> in the 1996 Olympics, he went on to play three more international games for Nigeria. The November 1996 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> qualifiers against <a href="Burkina%20Faso%20national%20football%20team">Burkina Faso</a>, which the Super Eagles won 2–0 in Lagos. The friendly against <a href="Morocco%20national%20football%20team">Morocco</a> in December 1996, where he kept another clean sheet, and the FIFA World Cup qualifier against <a href="Kenya%20national%20football%20team">Kenya</a> in January 1997. The match against Kenya which ended in a 1–1 draw, was his last game for the Nigeria.
Coaching career.
He started his coaching career 2009 as Head coach by Lagos-based <a href="Westerlo%20Football%20Academy">Westerlo Football Academy</a>.
